This notebook creates views over the SAP HR data to ensure all Staff_Number or Pers_No columns are aligned.

**Method**

1. If the 6-digit SAP code starts with a 4, it can also be found prefixed with 50
2. If the 6-digit SAP code starts with a 5, it can also be found prefixed with 00


**SQL Code**

```
    CASE 
        WHEN LENGTH(Staff_Number) = 6 AND SUBSTR(Staff_Number,1,1) = 5 
        THEN concat('00',Staff_Number) 
        WHEN LENGTH(Staff_Number) = 6 AND SUBSTR(Staff_Number,1,1) = 4 
        THEN concat('50',Staff_Number)
        ELSE Staff_Number
    End as Staff_Number
```

%%sql
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW odw_standardised_db.vw_absences
    AS 
    SELECT 
        CASE 
            WHEN LENGTH(Staff_Number) = 6 AND SUBSTR(Staff_Number,1,1) = 5 
            THEN concat('00',Staff_Number) 
            WHEN LENGTH(Staff_Number) = 6 AND SUBSTR(Staff_Number,1,1) = 4 
            THEN concat('50',Staff_Number)
            ELSE Staff_Number
        End as Staff_Number,
        Abs_Type,
        Sickness_Group,
        Start_Date,
        End_Date,
        Attendance_or_Absence_Type,
        Days,
        Hrs,
        Start,
        End_time,
        Cal_days,
        Work_Schedule_Rule,
        Wk_Hrs,
        Hrs_Day,
        WkDys,
        Annual_Leave_Start 
    FROM odw_standardised_db.absences;

%%sql
select Staff_number from odw_standardised_db.vw_absences
group by Staff_number
